segment.source: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers
segment.target: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers

segment.source: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers
segment.target: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers

segment.source: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers
segment.target: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers

segment.source: The procedures in this topic describe the full installation of the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) features on distributed servers.
segment.target: The procedures in this topic describe the full installation of the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) features on distributed servers.

segment.source: Each server feature has certain prerequisites.
segment.target: Each server feature has certain prerequisites.

segment.source: To verify that you have met the prerequisites and hardware and software requirements, see MBAM 1.0 Deployment Prerequisites and MBAM 1.0 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: To verify that you have met the prerequisites and hardware and software requirements, see MBAM 1.0 Deployment Prerequisites and MBAM 1.0 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: In addition, some features require that you provide certain information during the installation process to successfully deploy the feature.
segment.target: In addition, some features require that you provide certain information during the installation process to successfully deploy the feature.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To obtain the setup log files, you have to install MBAM by using the msiexec package and the /l location option.
segment.target: To obtain the setup log files, you have to install MBAM by using the msiexec package and the /l location option.

segment.source: Log files are created in the location that you specify.
segment.target: Log files are created in the location that you specify.

segment.source: Additional setup log files are created in the %temp% folder of the user that runs the MBAM installation.
segment.target: Additional setup log files are created in the %temp% folder of the user that runs the MBAM installation.

segment.source: Deploy the MBAM Server features
segment.target: Deploy the MBAM Server features

segment.source: The following steps describe how to install the general MBAM features.
segment.target: The following steps describe how to install the general MBAM features.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Make sure that you use the 32-bit setup on 32-bit servers and the 64-bit setup on 64-bit servers.
segment.target: Make sure that you use the 32-bit setup on 32-bit servers and the 64-bit setup on 64-bit servers.

segment.source: To Deploy MBAM Server features
segment.target: To Deploy MBAM Server features

segment.source: Start the MBAM installation wizard, and click Install at the Welcome page.
segment.target: Start the MBAM installation wizard, and click Install at the Welcome page.

segment.source: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Terms, and then click Next to continue the installation.
segment.target: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Terms, and then click Next to continue the installation.

segment.source: By default, all MBAM features are selected for installation.
segment.target: By default, all MBAM features are selected for installation.

segment.source: Clear the features that you want to install elsewhere.
segment.target: Clear the features that you want to install elsewhere.

segment.source: Features that you want to install on the same computer must be installed all at the same time.
segment.target: Features that you want to install on the same computer must be installed all at the same time.

segment.source: MBAM features must be installed in the following order:
segment.target: MBAM features must be installed in the following order:

segment.source: Recovery and Hardware Database
segment.target: Recovery and Hardware Database

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: Compliance Audit and Reports
segment.target: Compliance Audit and Reports

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Server
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Server

segment.source: MBAM Group Policy Template
segment.target: MBAM Group Policy Template

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The installation wizard checks the prerequisites for your installation and displays the prerequisites that are missing.
segment.target: The installation wizard checks the prerequisites for your installation and displays the prerequisites that are missing.

segment.source: If all the prerequisites are met, the installation continues.
segment.target: If all the prerequisites are met, the installation continues.

segment.source: If a missing prerequisite is detected, you have to resolve the missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.
segment.target: If a missing prerequisite is detected, you have to resolve the missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.

segment.source: If all prerequisites are met this time, the installation will resume.
segment.target: If all prerequisites are met this time, the installation will resume.

segment.source: The MBAM Setup wizard will display the installation pages for the selected features.
segment.target: The MBAM Setup wizard will display the installation pages for the selected features.

segment.source: The following sections describe the installation procedures for each feature.
segment.target: The following sections describe the installation procedures for each feature.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Typically, each feature is installed on a separate server.
segment.target: Typically, each feature is installed on a separate server.

segment.source: If you want to install multiple features on a single server, you may change or eliminate some of the following steps.
segment.target: If you want to install multiple features on a single server, you may change or eliminate some of the following steps.

segment.source: To install the Recovery and Hardware Database
segment.target: To install the Recovery and Hardware Database

segment.source: Choose an option for MBAM communication encryption.
segment.target: Choose an option for MBAM communication encryption.

segment.source: MBAM can encrypt the communication between the Recovery and Hardware Database and the Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: MBAM can encrypt the communication between the Recovery and Hardware Database and the Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: If you choose the option to encrypt communication, you are asked to select the authority-provisioned certificate that is used for encryption.
segment.target: If you choose the option to encrypt communication, you are asked to select the authority-provisioned certificate that is used for encryption.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the names of the computers that will be running the Administration and Monitoring Server feature, to configure access to the Recovery and Hardware Database..
segment.target: Specify the names of the computers that will be running the Administration and Monitoring Server feature, to configure access to the Recovery and Hardware Database..

segment.source: Once the Administration and Monitoring Server feature is deployed, it connects to the database by using its domain account.
segment.target: Once the Administration and Monitoring Server feature is deployed, it connects to the database by using its domain account.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the Database Configuration for the SQL Server instance that stores the recovery and hardware data.
segment.target: Specify the Database Configuration for the SQL Server instance that stores the recovery and hardware data.

segment.source: You must also specify where the database will be located and where the log information will be located.
segment.target: You must also specify where the database will be located and where the log information will be located.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.

segment.source: To install the Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: To install the Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: Choose an option for the MBAM communication encryption.
segment.target: Choose an option for the MBAM communication encryption.

segment.source: MBAM can encrypt the communication between the Compliance and Audit Database and the Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: MBAM can encrypt the communication between the Compliance and Audit Database and the Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: If you choose the option to encrypt communication, you are asked to select the authority-provisioned certificate that will be used for encryption.
segment.target: If you choose the option to encrypt communication, you are asked to select the authority-provisioned certificate that will be used for encryption.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the user account that will be used to access the database for reports.
segment.target: Specify the user account that will be used to access the database for reports.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the computer names of the computers that you want to run the Administration and Monitoring Server and the Compliance and Audit Reports, to configure the access to the Compliance and Audit Database..
segment.target: Specify the computer names of the computers that you want to run the Administration and Monitoring Server and the Compliance and Audit Reports, to configure the access to the Compliance and Audit Database..

segment.source: After the Administration and Monitoring and the Compliance and Audit Reports Server are deployed, they will connect to the databases by using their domain accounts.
segment.target: After the Administration and Monitoring and the Compliance and Audit Reports Server are deployed, they will connect to the databases by using their domain accounts.

segment.source: Specify the Database Configuration for the SQL Server instance that will store the compliance and audit data.
segment.target: Specify the Database Configuration for the SQL Server instance that will store the compliance and audit data.

segment.source: You must also specify where the database will be located and where the log information will be located.
segment.target: You must also specify where the database will be located and where the log information will be located.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.

segment.source: To install the Compliance and Audit Reports
segment.target: To install the Compliance and Audit Reports

segment.source: Specify the remote SQL Server instance.
segment.target: Specify the remote SQL Server instance.

segment.source: For example, ServerName,where the Compliance and Audit Database are installed.
segment.target: For example, ServerName,where the Compliance and Audit Database are installed.

segment.source: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is “MBAM Compliance Status”, but you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: By default, the database name is “MBAM Compliance Status”, but you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Select the SQL Server Reporting Services instance where the Compliance and Audit Reports will be installed.
segment.target: Select the SQL Server Reporting Services instance where the Compliance and Audit Reports will be installed.

segment.source: Provide the username and password used to access the compliance database.
segment.target: Provide the username and password used to access the compliance database.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.

segment.source: To install the Administration and Monitoring Server feature
segment.target: To install the Administration and Monitoring Server feature

segment.source: Choose an option for the MBAM communication encryption.
segment.target: Choose an option for the MBAM communication encryption.

segment.source: MBAM can encrypt the communication between the Recovery and Hardware Database and the Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: MBAM can encrypt the communication between the Recovery and Hardware Database and the Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: If you choose the option to encrypt communication, you are asked to select the authority-provisioned certificate that is used for encryption.
segment.target: If you choose the option to encrypt communication, you are asked to select the authority-provisioned certificate that is used for encryption.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the remote SQL Server instance, For example, ServerName, where the Compliance and Audit Database are installed.
segment.target: Specify the remote SQL Server instance, For example, ServerName, where the Compliance and Audit Database are installed.

segment.source: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status, but, you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status, but, you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the remote SQL Server instance.
segment.target: Specify the remote SQL Server instance.

segment.source: For example, ServerName,where the Recovery and Hardware Database are installed.
segment.target: For example, ServerName,where the Recovery and Hardware Database are installed.

segment.source: Specify the name of the Recovery and Hardware Database.
segment.target: Specify the name of the Recovery and Hardware Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery and Hardware, but you can change the name when you install the Recovery and Hardware Database feature.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery and Hardware, but you can change the name when you install the Recovery and Hardware Database feature.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the URL for the “Home” of the SQL Server Reporting Services (SRS) site.
segment.target: Specify the URL for the “Home” of the SQL Server Reporting Services (SRS) site.

segment.source: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance is at:
segment.target: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance is at:

segment.source: http://NameofMBAMReportsServerReportServer
segment.target: http://NameofMBAMReportsServerReportServer

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you configured the SQL Server Reporting Services as a named instance, the URL resembles the following:http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/ReportServerSRSInstanceName
segment.target: If you configured the SQL Server Reporting Services as a named instance, the URL resembles the following:http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/ReportServerSRSInstanceName

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Enter the Port Number, the Host Name (optional), and the Installation Path for the MBAM Administration and Monitoring server
segment.target: Enter the Port Number, the Host Name (optional), and the Installation Path for the MBAM Administration and Monitoring server

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: The port number that you specify must be an unused port number on the Administration and Monitoring server, unless you specify a unique host header name.
segment.target: The port number that you specify must be an unused port number on the Administration and Monitoring server, unless you specify a unique host header name.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.

segment.source: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.
segment.target: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.

segment.source: When the selected MBAM feature information is complete, you are ready to start the MBAM installation by using the Setup wizard.
segment.target: When the selected MBAM feature information is complete, you are ready to start the MBAM installation by using the Setup wizard.

segment.source: Click Back to move through the wizard if you have to review or change your installation settings.
segment.target: Click Back to move through the wizard if you have to review or change your installation settings.

segment.source: Click Install to begin the installation.
segment.target: Click Install to begin the installation.

segment.source: Click Cancel to exit the Wizard.
segment.target: Click Cancel to exit the Wizard.

segment.source: Setup installs the MBAM features that you selected and notifies you that the installation is finished.
segment.target: Setup installs the MBAM features that you selected and notifies you that the installation is finished.

segment.source: Click Finish to exit the wizard.
segment.target: Click Finish to exit the wizard.

segment.source: Add users to appropriate MBAM roles, after the MBAM server features are installed..
segment.target: Add users to appropriate MBAM roles, after the MBAM server features are installed..

segment.source: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 1.0 Administrator Roles.
segment.target: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 1.0 Administrator Roles.

segment.source: Post-installation configuration
segment.target: Post-installation configuration

segment.source: After MBAM Setup is finished, you must add user Roles before users can access to features in the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: After MBAM Setup is finished, you must add user Roles before users can access to features in the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: On the Administration and Monitoring Server, add users to the following local groups.
segment.target: On the Administration and Monitoring Server, add users to the following local groups.

segment.source: MBAM Hardware Users: Members of this local group can access the Hardware feature in the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: MBAM Hardware Users: Members of this local group can access the Hardware feature in the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: MBAM Helpdesk Users: Members of this local group can access the Drive Recovery and Manage Trusted Platform Modules (TPM) features in the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: MBAM Helpdesk Users: Members of this local group can access the Drive Recovery and Manage Trusted Platform Modules (TPM) features in the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: All fields in Drive Recovery and Manage TPM are required fields for a Helpdesk User.
segment.target: All fields in Drive Recovery and Manage TPM are required fields for a Helpdesk User.

segment.source: MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users: Members of this local group have advanced access to the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features in the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users: Members of this local group have advanced access to the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features in the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: For Advanced Helpdesk Users, only the Key ID field is required in Drive Recovery.
segment.target: For Advanced Helpdesk Users, only the Key ID field is required in Drive Recovery.

segment.source: In Manage TPM, only the Computer Domain field and Computer Name field are required.
segment.target: In Manage TPM, only the Computer Domain field and Computer Name field are required.

segment.source: On the Administration and Monitoring Server, Compliance and Audit Database, and on the server that hosts the Compliance and Audit Reports, add users to the following local group to give them access to the Reports feature in the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: On the Administration and Monitoring Server, Compliance and Audit Database, and on the server that hosts the Compliance and Audit Reports, add users to the following local group to give them access to the Reports feature in the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: MBAM Report Users: Members of this local group can access the Reports in the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: MBAM Report Users: Members of this local group can access the Reports in the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Identical user or group membership of the MBAM Report Users local group must be maintained on all computers where the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server features, Compliance and Audit Database, and the Compliance and Audit Reports are installed.
segment.target: Identical user or group membership of the MBAM Report Users local group must be maintained on all computers where the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server features, Compliance and Audit Database, and the Compliance and Audit Reports are installed.

segment.source: Validate the MBAM Server feature installation
segment.target: Validate the MBAM Server feature installation

segment.source: When the MBAM Server feature installation is complete, you should validate that the installation has successfully set up all the necessary features for MBAM.
segment.target: When the MBAM Server feature installation is complete, you should validate that the installation has successfully set up all the necessary features for MBAM.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to confirm that the MBAM service is functional.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to confirm that the MBAM service is functional.

segment.source: To validate an MBAM installation
segment.target: To validate an MBAM installation

segment.source: On each server, where an MBAM feature is deployed, open Control Panel, click Programs, and then click Programs and Features.
segment.target: On each server, where an MBAM feature is deployed, open Control Panel, click Programs, and then click Programs and Features.

segment.source: Verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears in the Programs and Features list.
segment.target: Verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears in the Programs and Features list.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To validate the MBAM installation, you must use a Domain Account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.
segment.target: To validate the MBAM installation, you must use a Domain Account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.

segment.source: On the server where the Recovery and Hardware Database is installed, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database is installed.
segment.target: On the server where the Recovery and Hardware Database is installed, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database is installed.

segment.source: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is installed, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Compliance Status database is installed.
segment.target: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is installed, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Compliance Status database is installed.

segment.source: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Reports are installed, open a web browser with administrative privileges and browse to the “Home” of the SQL Server Reporting Services site.
segment.target: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Reports are installed, open a web browser with administrative privileges and browse to the “Home” of the SQL Server Reporting Services site.

segment.source: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance can be found at http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/Reports.aspx.
segment.target: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance can be found at http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/Reports.aspx.

segment.source: To find the actual URL, use the Reporting Services Configuration Manager tool and select the instances specified during setup.
segment.target: To find the actual URL, use the Reporting Services Configuration Manager tool and select the instances specified during setup.

segment.source: Confirm that a folder named Malta Compliance Reports is listed and that it contains five reports and one data source.
segment.target: Confirm that a folder named Malta Compliance Reports is listed and that it contains five reports and one data source.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If SQL Server Reporting Services was configured as a named instance, the URL should resemble the following:http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/ReportsSRSInstanceName
segment.target: If SQL Server Reporting Services was configured as a named instance, the URL should resemble the following:http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/ReportsSRSInstanceName

segment.source: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring feature is installed, run Server Manager and browse to Roles, select Web Server (IIS), and then click Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager.
segment.target: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring feature is installed, run Server Manager and browse to Roles, select Web Server (IIS), and then click Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager.

segment.source: In Connections browse to computername, click Sites, and click Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: In Connections browse to computername, click Sites, and click Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: Verify that MBAMAdministrationService, MBAMComplianceStatusService, and MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService are listed.
segment.target: Verify that MBAMAdministrationService, MBAMComplianceStatusService, and MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService are listed.

segment.source: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring feature is installed, open a web browser with administrative privileges and browse to the following locations in the MBAM web site, to verify that they load successfully:
segment.target: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring feature is installed, open a web browser with administrative privileges and browse to the following locations in the MBAM web site, to verify that they load successfully:

segment.source: http://computername/default.aspx and confirm each of the links for navigation and reports
segment.target: http://computername/default.aspx and confirm each of the links for navigation and reports

segment.source: http://computername/MBAMAdministrationService/AdministrationService.svc
segment.target: http://computername/MBAMAdministrationService/AdministrationService.svc

segment.source: http://computername/MBAMComplianceStatusService/StatusReportingService.svc
segment.target: http://computername/MBAMComplianceStatusService/StatusReportingService.svc

segment.source: http://computername/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc
segment.target: http://computername/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Typically, services are installed on the default port 80 without network encryption.
segment.target: Typically, services are installed on the default port 80 without network encryption.

segment.source: If the services are installed on a different port, change the URLs to include the appropriate port.
segment.target: If the services are installed on a different port, change the URLs to include the appropriate port.

segment.source: For example, http://computername:port/default.aspx or http://hostheadernamedefault.aspx
segment.target: For example, http://computername:port/default.aspx or http://hostheadernamedefault.aspx

segment.source: If the services were installed with network encryption, change http:// to https://.
segment.target: If the services were installed with network encryption, change http:// to https://.

segment.source: Verify that each web page loads successfully.
segment.target: Verify that each web page loads successfully.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Deploying the MBAM 1.0 Server Infrastructure
segment.target: Deploying the MBAM 1.0 Server Infrastructure
